You are an expert coding instructor. Below is a clean, perfectly working code snippet in web. Your task is to introduce a realistic, subtle, and educational bug into this code (e.g., an off-by-one error, an incorrect variable reference, missing return, logic flaw). const textEl = document.getElementById('text')
const speedEl = document.getElementById('speed')
const text = 'We Love Programming!'
let idx = 1
let speed = 300 / speedEl.value

writeText()

function writeText() {
    textEl.innerText = text.slice(0, idx)

    idx++

    if(idx > text.length) {
        idx = 1
    }

    setTimeout(writeText, speed)
}


speedEl.addEventListener('input', (e) => speed = 300 / e.target.value)
```

const buttons = document.querySelectorAll('.ripple')

buttons.forEach(button => {
    button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
        const x = e.pageX
        const y = e.pageY

        const buttonTop = e.target.offsetTop
        const buttonLeft = e.target.offsetLeft

        const xInside = x - buttonLeft
        const yInside = y - buttonTop

        const circle = document.createElement('span')
        circle.classList.add('circle')
        circle.style.top = yInside + 'px'
        circle.style.left = xInside + 'px'

        this.appendChild(circle)

        setTimeout(() => circle.remove(), 500)
    })
})
```

const buttons = document.querySelectorAll('.ripple')

buttons.forEach(button => {
    button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
        const x = e.pageX
        const y = e.pageY

        const buttonTop = e.target.offsetTop
        const buttonLeft = e.target.offsetLeft

        const xInside = x - buttonLeft
        const yInside = y - buttonTop

        const circle = document.createElement('span')
        circle.classList.add('circle')
        circle.style.top = yInside + 'px'
        circle.style.left = xInside + 'px'

        this.appendChild(circle)

        setTimeout(() => circle.remove(), 500)
    })
})
```
